result.execSummary:
The defendant Norvice Deon Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Child Abuse-High Probability/Great Harm, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Hearing 7/23/2015.
*7/23/2015  Hearing is now 8/12/2015.
***8-12-2015, Judge Wagner; Court ordered restitution in the amount of $1784.40 payable to Milwaukee County Clerks office.  Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.  Restitution to receive first priority over all other costs, fees, surcharges, and/or fines.  Failure to pay by the end of supervision will result in civil judgment.***

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge,  all applicable costs, surcharges, victim witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge and  supervision fees as determined by DOC.  To be paid during period of Extended Supervision or civil judgment.  bail to apply.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts two and three. Credit for six days.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED/HSED.  Obtain and maintain employment.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victim Mykala W. without prior Court approval.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continue programming.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Defendant to particpate in alcohol and drug assessment  and successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
**11-09-15/ Judge Jeffrey A Wagner**
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended by commuting the term of Extended Supervision on Count one to three years.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts  one and three.  Credit for six days.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with counts one and two.  Credit for six days.

Defendant Norvice Deon Jones in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Presentence report reviewed.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Additional statements by: Gwendolyn Jones-Henderson. 

AS TO COUNT #1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS (CONCURRENT to counts 2 and 3), with credit for 6 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT #2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS (CONCURRENT to counts 1 and 3), with credit for 6 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  

AS TO COUNT #3: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS (CONCURRENT to counts 2 and 3), with credit for 6 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Mykala W. 
   without prior court approval.   
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.  
   ---- Cash bail to apply.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank 
   and pay all appropriate costs.
* Restitution Hearing scheduled in Branch 4 on 7-23-2015 at 1:30 pm.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Norvice Deon Jones in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
P.M.
Jury in box.  At the hour of 1:35 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY on COUNT #1, COUNT #2 and COUNT #3 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.   Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-18-2015 at 8:30 am.  PSI is ordered with recommendation.  Oral arguments heard as to bail.  Court ordered cash bail increased to $2,000.00 with gps supervision.  Court ordered that the defendant remains under conditions, if released, gps supervision, no violations of the law, no drugs, no weapons and absolute sobriety.   mld
